p: 3. Ex-sistence is both closest to us and farthest from us. Ex-sistence is both closest to us and farthest from us. We showed that ex-sistence has ontic-ontological priority. However, whereas our own being is ontically closest to us, it is ontologically (i.e., in terms of its proper “categorial” status) farthest from us—and in fact hidden from us—despite our pre-theoretical understanding of it.
